DOC.HEAD: Judge Rules on Home for `Lost County'
DOC.TEXT: A couple had declared their acre of land to be without a county, but a federal judge says otherwise and now they face the inevitable _ a $1,200 bill for back taxes. But Tom and Brenda Norton still haven't taken down their hand-painted sign that reads ``Lost County. Pop. 2.'' The Nortons bought the land from Mrs. Norton's uncle in 1986 and paid property taxes to Jasper County. After they started a building for their family business, Jasper County officials discovered the land was in Newton County. They filed a lawsuit in 1987. Norton refused to pay Newton County taxes on the land for the past three years because of the dispute. Now, county officials say he owes $1,200. U.S. District Judge Robert L. Vining last week granted the counties' request to end the matter. Officials said an independent survey last year determined that the property was part of Newton County in southwestern Georgia.
